Body:
A word in one language can be translated to multiple words in another language but with different popularity for each translation. Is the "popularity" or "commonality" symmetric? For example:

Translating "Hello" to French can give you:

  • "Hello" -> "Bonjour" (Most popular)
  • "Hello" -> "Salut" (Medium popularity)
  • "Hello" -> "Tiens" (Least popular)

and translating "Bonjour" to English would lead "Hello" as the most popular followed by "Hi" and "Good Morning"

Which in this example means that the most popular translation of "hello" to French is "bonjour" and the most popular translation of "bonjour" to English is "hello"

Is this always the case in translations from one language to another?

Does the popularity of a translation of a word from one language to another signify the popularity of the translation from the other language to the first one?
Title: language translation commonality
